website_summaries.verdict: The Dymo LabelWriter 450 delivers more than acceptable speed and can print on a variety of labels, including postage labels (with an upgrade) using the Endicia Web site.
pros: Comes with excellent label-printing program plus driver and add-ins for Word and Excel
Can be upgraded to print postage
cons: Word add-in doesn't integrate smoothly with Microsoft Word

customer_reviews.title: This printer has been nothing but Amazing for us
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for something that would work with Stamps.com without having to buy the Stamps.com hardware they sell at a much higher price. This printer has been nothing but Amazing for us. It definitely makes out envelopes look a lot more professional than manually handwriting the address on each envelope. I also like the fact that we can change the tape to different sizes for different uses.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Garcia

customer_reviews.title: It worked fine for a week and now the labels won't print ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of rubbish. It worked fine for a week and now the labels won't print or advance no matter what. I uninstalled and re-installed the software and drivers 3 times (always restarting my computer) and followed at least 5 procedures I found online for trouble shooting. Pressing the eject button does nothing except elicit a whining tone. It keeps telling me it is in an error state and Printing Picture when I am trying to print text.
customer_reviews.author: delta500

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Love it!  Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated with this purchase. Nothing seems to work with my computer. This label printer did!!! I couldn't believe it. It was easy to assemble and I started printing address labels immediately! This item deserves 10 stars....100 stars (whatever the limit). If you're looking for a label printer, this is the one for you. It even prints stamps, which I won't use, but IT DOES! I'm giddy! Giddy!!!! Thank you all my helpers who aided with my decision on which one to purchase. I asked you questions, and your responded. If someone asks me....I will think of each and every one of you who responded, and take up the gauntlet. It's a great item. Easy to assemble. No problems. Wow!
customer_reviews.author: O.R.

customer_reviews.title: This is not ok.
customer_reviews.text: My label printer came used and cracked. This is very frustrating. Another customer had this same problem and gave it a bad review for the same reason. Looks to me they just sold the same one to me.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Dymo LabelWriter 450 Thermal Label Printer-SAVE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: This Dymo LabelWriter 450 was replaced for being defective and here I am again. Just outside warranty. THIS IS SIMPLY NOT A GOOD PRODUCT. AND there is no phone number to call and discuss with Amazon. Frankly you would be better off spending your money on Lotto tickets. Very disappointing, especially given I pay for Amazon Prime. Update: Nov 22,3018. I did not update this and should have. I did reach Smaxon and they got me to the selling company. They did a small refunf, but a lot better than nothing. Now I try very hard yo buy directly from Amazon which is never a problem.
customer_reviews.author: CAB

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the purpose of printing barcodes for my online business and I have had no issues so far. (And my cat is fascinated by it.) It works as expected and I love that I don't have to buy ink. It took a minute to figure it all out with the program, but once you read through the instructions and mess with it, it is pretty easy. (I am not a techie and I was able to get it to do what I wanted.)
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: I can't get this junk to work
customer_reviews.text: I am tech savvy but this machine absolutely doesn't print. I have been on a few forums and wasted 2 hours of my time and I am completely frustrated. If they don't want you to plug and play send a cd. Called tech support and we determined that either the software is not compatible with Windows or the machine is broken. Never used it once and spent 6 hours trying to get it to work. Such a waste of time and money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For my USPS Shipping Labels
customer_reviews.text: It’s perfect for my shipping labels!! I used 30256 labels !!! Small but perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Kim B.

customer_reviews.title: The best way to print out 4x6 labels for your Amazon packages
customer_reviews.text: We used to print out our labels on paper and then cut them out and tape them on. That was until we discovered this little gem. Now we use it and easily print out and stick on 100s of labels a week. This is actually a backup to our printer that we ordered just in case, and we needed it as our other one broke.
customer_reviews.author: GchanMako

customer_reviews.title: No longer supported!
customer_reviews.text: This worked great until it didn’t. Something changed and I suddenly couldn’t print labels in the correct orientation. I followed every fix offered by Dymo, tried every fix for Mac. Bought a windows machine and tried setting it up with a new computer and new installation. It wouldn’t print landscape. I tried ever setting in every control panel. Nothing worked. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Cougill

customer_reviews.title: Great printer! Software pitiful
customer_reviews.text: I like the printer. I didn’t have any problem loading labels. As a mater of fact it was rather easy. My gripe is the software. It isn’t user friendly. I called the help desk for help. After two calls they downloaded a video from YouTube that didn’t have any sound. To day is the day I either plan on sending the Dymo back after I give the old college or keeping it. This item should have an instruction manual for how to use the software. DISAPPOINTED IN THE SOFTWARE. The help desk should change their name to “ no help desk “
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: The documentation for this printer and the software Dymo puts out is very poor
customer_reviews.text: I lucked out one time in getting the label printing software Dymo makes to find and use the contacts on my Mac. Well, got a new Mac. I cannot figure out, even while studying the manual, how to get it to populate the contacts. This software is not intuitive and very hard to use. This printer seems great. It's the software from Dymo that is just awful. I am looking for something else to purchase. Used to have a Seiko label printer that was wonderful, and the software was intuitive and easy to use. Dymo seems pretty crummy in comparison. I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Quotes&More

customer_reviews.title: OMG If you print eBay labels 2 by 7 you should have it
customer_reviews.text: I received this printer label today and tried to install myself but end up calling customer support. The guy was supportive and was with me all the time on the phone explaining me how to install the printer and software. It was really great! It works with my MAC BOOK PRO 10.13.6!!! After you install the printer and test it go to eBay and try to create the label, change size to 2x7 size and click preview and try to print an example. When you print put right size of paper 99019 in printing choice and scale 100%. And you good to go! I AM SO HAPPY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Zhanna mizgina

customer_reviews.title: Not Quickbooks compatible
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase this printer if you expect it to interface with Quickbooks Desktop Pro 2019 or 2020. The manufacturer seems uninterested in making the interface work. It worked with 2018, but that was the last version their tech support said was supported and he could not tell me when or if they would ever get the issue resolved. I will be returning it because that was my main use for the printer, was to print address labels from the customer invoice screen. Pretty bad when your product will not work with one of the largest accounting software programs there is.
customer_reviews.author: don hunter

customer_reviews.title: Labels inside of printer - used?
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work as advertised. However, mine arrived with 2 random labels on the inside, one of them half-way stuck where labels would normally come out of the machine. And the labels inside the printer are not the same size as the starter roll labels that come with the printer. I'm immediately suspicious whether I received a new printer, or one someone else returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy because it is not good printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer. But it doesn’t work like printer because it is likely paper cutter :(( don’t buy never!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Strong

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: After giving this as a gift to my wife for Christmas we open the box and the drivers software has to come from the website and a disc is no longer available when you buy one. Call Tech services and they are only open during the week the same hours my wife and I work. This means I have to take a day off from work if I can get help with the product. Now this is just a paperweight and is worthless to us. Nothing against the seller just a poor product backed with work hours tech service. Waste of money in my eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Oustlander

customer_reviews.title: Great little unit! Works well. Many applications
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I'm a labeling nut and own a P-Touch which I love, as well. They generally fill different labeling niches, but with {obviously} a certain amount of overlap in use/application. Because I like it so much, I'm finding myself just a little disappointed that I didn't opt for a more expensive, perhaps more versatile model, but this is still great! I do wish the interface screen was a bit more versatile and diverse in offerings/options, but I suspect additional features may be available on in more expensive models
customer_reviews.author: Yardley

customer_reviews.title: Finally a label maker that works well with Mac
customer_reviews.text: For some reason the makers of labe makers (for example Brother) have always struggled to make a good product for the Mac. I have had many problems with serial port incompatibility, lousy installation processes, and ugly and non-functional software. Many. The Dymo LabelWriter 450 is the first one that immediately communicated with the USB C port, installed the downloaded software without error, and has a reasonably nice user interface. Lable installation was also a breeze with clear instructions. Very happy with this purchase and if you are a Mac user (in particular) you should give it serious consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Colacino

customer_reviews.title: Simple, easy, but needs dymo labels
customer_reviews.text: Clear, fast printing. Dymo basic label software is simple and straightforward. I have not used the other, more advanced software, but it appears it would offer more customization options. Loading and use is simple. NOTE that this requires dymo label stock, or something compatible. This is not a thermal transfer printer, so regular thermal transfer labels will not work. But dymo labels are set up for simplicity. They index automatically so there's no need to meticulously align end of labels. Installation was simple. Download label software. Plug in printer. Go. I would certainly purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Poor install instructions, good product
customer_reviews.text: The user guide leaves alot to be desired. It makes no mention of how to install the software so I had to pull the drivers from the DYMO site. Once I did that the install was successful. Just a caveat for those who might encounter the same issue. Works just fine if all you're seeking is black and white. I might have grabbed another one that printed color if it really mattered. Overall a good product and no ink needed.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos 517

customer_reviews.title: Bulky power supply, Buggy software and drivers
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Numerous options for label sizes. Works great when it works. Cons The switching power supply is very bulky, along the lines of a Dell laptop power brick. Combine that with the required USB cable for data connection, and you're in for a much larger footprint than the picture indicates. The label making software is pretty dated and buggy. Wastes labels and jams frequently. Drivers will decide when you are out of labels, and they'll hang onto that notion regardless of reality.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: works extremely well. I would most certainly purchase another one if needed.
customer_reviews.text: I have printed thousands of labels with this printer and it's great. The software is very easy to use, just make sure to download the correct version of the software on their website. The machine comes with a sample label installed, That doesn't mean it was in used condition like others have posted. I wouldn't hesitate to purchase another. If you plan to print on heat shrink tubing for wiring projects the other units they sell with the dual cartridge would work perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost Returned it; Glad I Didn't
customer_reviews.text: Small footprint; does a decent job with labels. It apparently does not have a "clear paper path" feature. One of the print jobs got off track and the thing tried to wad a whole roll of labels inside the print head. That eventually jammed it and it took a while to figure out how to clear it. Eventually was able to pull the excess label feed out a millimeter at a time. No option to open the paper path, as on most printers. At this point, I like it, and will continue to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware, terrible software
customer_reviews.text: It's a great printer, but the software (especially for Mac) is very frustrating. There are many problems with QR codes, inserting data, and saving. Customer support is aware of the problems but says there is no fix. I've had to write my own code in Javascript to best use my printer. Uhh!
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Leopold

customer_reviews.title: Dymo printing software would not connect to labeler.
customer_reviews.text: My Dymo label printer PNP quit working, so I ordered this LabelWriter. As the installation instructions required, I first loaded the software, then plugged in the LabelWriter and found that the Dymo software did not recognize it as a printer. I rebooted my computer, deleted the Dymo software and then re-installed it. When that didn't work, I wrote an e-mail asking for instructions and did not receive a reply. So, I returned this product and purchased a Brother P-touch printer instead (also from Amazon). The Brother works great.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bogenrief

customer_reviews.title: Printer Drivers need work
customer_reviews.text: Trying to use this printer for labels with barcodes produced with MS Access (2016 & 2019). The printer driver keeps defaulting to a single label size I am not using. Called Dymo and they said they are working on new printer drivers but may come too late for my needs. Used both Label Wizard and created custom label report and drivers were not up to task. Would not save "user defined" dimensions. Print quality very nice. Would rate it higher if it could work with my project.
customer_reviews.author: Phil R

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and speed
customer_reviews.text: I use this for printing labels to keep track of wine inventory. I used to print out on label sheets but the quality of the print job was not always great. This is much easier, I just send over the labels I want printed and it rolls them out in very clear print and bar codes. The labels are a bit bigger than I would have wanted which is my only complaint, but perhaps they have a smaller set I can buy as the label size is adjustable in the printer. Overall I'm very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mark T

customer_reviews.title: It’s easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I like this label printer. I had one at work so was already familiar with it. I retired in February this year and I’m using it to help get my home more organized. The print quality is good. Tech support was great - I called them to help me install it and they walked me through it. It’s easy to use but I need to read the manual so I can know how to do everything with it. There are a lot of different size labels so make sure you get the size you want.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: We do not like at all.
customer_reviews.text: The DYNO we had before we loved - it was perfect. We don't like this one and wish we had spent more money as this is no good. Spend more -buy next one up in price and see if it works,
customer_reviews.author: jane

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The hardest part in setting this up was finding the size labels I needed. It was very easy to set up, super easy to use, it is lightweight and small enough to fit in the small space I have to work in. The labels print nicely, and it's just simply fun to use. I'm not sure when I will need to buy another, because it seems pretty durable, but I would definitely recommend to anyone that needs to print shipping labels one at a time and not a whole sheet. The printer is as described, arrived on time, and good seller.
customer_reviews.author: CRich808

customer_reviews.title: I hate these printers
customer_reviews.text: We hate these but we have to use them because there the only ones that work for printing stamps, don't tear off stamps using the tear off cutter, it cuts the paper too short and you will catch the end and wind it around the roller eventually, then have fun unrolling the sticky stamps tightly wound and if you printed posted on a stamp you can kiss it good by.
customer_reviews.author: MJPIV

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE my printer
customer_reviews.text: Twice I have had to call customer service - both times they walked me through and had my problem solved in a matter of minutes. There was NO waiting on hold a long time, no confusing directions. Such nice customer service. I have had my printer a year and my second call to them was today - and they told me that there is a 2 year warranty on the printer - they told me if it breaks they will replace it
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Specht

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: It does what functions it says it will, but is very limited to customization. I couldn’t get some o the software to install so I had to contact tech support. I was greeted by a very rude representative that sounded like he had better things to do then help you. Very rude tone and helping me was a chore to him. Besides that, it was an okay system just to have around. But hated the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Hoa T.

customer_reviews.title: Works well for labels, etc. Pretty decent software
customer_reviews.text: This is our fifth Dymo purchase. Our original purchase was a Dymo mailing solution that included a scale and blank stamps. The printer lasted 6-7 years and the scale worked well until our cat ate the proprietary cord. we added this printer so we did not have to swap out labels and postage blanks.This one is loaded always with address labels. The other, a Twin Turbo - is now always loaded with file folder labels and postage blanks for Dymo Stamps. The interface for selecting which printer needs updating, but easy to get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: DML

customer_reviews.title: Affordable e-juice labeling!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to print off labels for DIY e-juice and for that purpose it has performed beyond my expectations. I was drawn to this product specifically due to the lack of ink, size, price, and efficiency, It's thermal, so you are limited to black and white, but with any experience in graphics design you can easily make an aesthetically pleasing label that gets the job done. Since I was having trouble figuring this out myself, I found that the best labels for DIY e-juice applications are the 1 1/8" x 3 1/2" address labels.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good label printer
customer_reviews.text: My garden club bought this label maker to print labels for the plants we sell at our annual plant sale. We wanted a thermal printer that was not too expensive, fast and could print on water resistant labels. I was tasked with selecting and setting up the printer. The start up booklet packaged with printer was easy to use and the download of the user manual and the software from the DYMO website was also easy. I think the DYMO screen display could be better designed and setting up templates a little easier. However, overall I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this label maker to label things around the house. The label maker instructions are clear, it is easy to set up, and easy to use. Once set up, the printer connects to your computer. You then design the label on your computer (and choose from a variety of fonts, font sizes, and orientations). When finished, you click print, and it immediately prints. The labels are a good size and can be easily applied to various surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian S

customer_reviews.title: This works so well - it's a plug & play solution that uses cheap non-brand labels.
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to set up - download the latest 'Dymo Connect' software from the Dymo website and then plug this little thing in when prompted, so it can be recognized automatically - then you are ready to print. Suggest you shop Amazon for non-brand labels to get the best value - the non-brand labels work great and are the same quality (material, adhesive etc) as branded.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Day

customer_reviews.title: Blue light it's annoying
customer_reviews.text: The bright blue LED that tells the printer it's communicating with whatever Operating system you're using, constantly blinks. So I have to face it to the wall or I just leave it disconnected until I have to use it.
customer_reviews.author: george a jaramillo

customer_reviews.title: It’s working great.  Alongside another Dymo 4XL
customer_reviews.text: Already had a Dymo 4XL. I bought this for smaller labels. Works great. Also cool on a hunch I didn’t think I needed to install Dymo package and drivers again. I wa right. Just plugged it in and windows 7 found it and installed it (already having installed Dymo software months ago). I’m very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: RYAN MACEWEN PRUYN

customer_reviews.title: Labels Galore
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my daughter who makes a lot of labels for her Craft Show items. Have used Dymo products for decades and trust the brand - this one lived up to the reputation. I especially like that there are a wide variety of label sizes to choose from now days.
customer_reviews.author: mikef

customer_reviews.title: Years of service and still working.
customer_reviews.text: Have some old dymo labels,same model as these and for years they been working perfectly. Got a bunch of new ones to deploy in the office and got same mosels since i know for a fact how good they are. Priting quality is great, small enough to stick anywhere, even easy to open up if jammed, can take apart without tools. Best labelmakers i jave used so far.
customer_reviews.author: Sigfredo Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Power packed mini.. Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Pros-Wanted to quickly print out labels for my shipping. This gets it done. Print quality is perfect and easy to use. Cons- You have to subscribe to the service. Either I missed that part or it wasn't stated. If you're OK with paying $9.99 monthly. Then it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: MsDorciah

customer_reviews.title: Fast and reliable Thermal Label Printer
customer_reviews.text: Superb Thermal Label Printer. I got an incredible experience using it. It helps me eliminate the waste, hassle of sheet labels, and the need for the expensive ink or toner. Scans up to a maximum of 200 pages per month, smoothly customize and print address, and create labels directly from text in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, QuickBooks. I really love working with it.
customer_reviews.author: Loyal Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: So many uses!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: So many uses for this thing. The software and hardware is pretty easy to install. Would recommend for anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Expected more :(
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer for work purposes.When I got my new printer, I started using and suddenly stuck. I bought different tags from different brands including the Dymo tags, thinking the tags were the problem. Sadly, the problem was the printer. I haven't been able to actually work with my printer because of this problem. Disappointed :(
customer_reviews.author: lainne

customer_reviews.title: Mine did not come with a starter roll.
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed that my printer did not come with a roll. I got my printer and was very excited to use it only to find out there were no labels. Now I am having to wait u til the labels come in.
customer_reviews.author: Shameka C.

customer_reviews.title: Very cool way to get quick labels and send them out
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to start mailing postcards, I like how easy it was to setup and start using. I just build out a spreadsheet in google and export to csv, then import it and pick the columns I want for each line. First couple prints will be crooked when you first load it, after about 3 it straightens itself out.
customer_reviews.author: Andy R. Herman

customer_reviews.title: I need a label printer that works.
customer_reviews.text: Dymo label maker, does not print. I downloaded the instructions from the internet. It’s connected but will not print. It also came with a cord from radio shack rather then the original cord. I will send back.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene

customer_reviews.title: Not good for shipping labels
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure it’s a fine printer for address labels, but did not work for me printing larger shipping labels. I purchased the largest labels available but printing on them is too small. By the time I realized it wasn’t going to work, it was too late to return and now I’m stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jane L.

customer_reviews.title: If you have a crhomebook DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the fact that its only suitable for Mac or PC. I personally have an HP CHROMEBOOK and it wast compatible at all! So disapointed and just upset. Waste of time and money smh.
customer_reviews.author: Angel B.

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I love this thing. I'm a court reporter and I use it to print my exhibit labels for the exhibits I mark. This is so fast and easy and looks super professional. I find the software a bit confusing, but that might just be me. I quit trying to figure it out and just do a work-around. I'm sure if I had someone to show me what to do, it'd be a snap. Even with the work-around it's easy and, as I said, the labels it prints are super nice.
customer_reviews.author: G Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to install. don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: The worst printer ever ..very very veryyyyy hard to install that stupid thing.. . 3 hours jumping from YouTube channel to other .. try to see on YouTube all of them they do have CD just mine without
customer_reviews.author: Karam Kadhim

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere unless you have money to burn on a subparagraph product
customer_reviews.text: All instructions have to be downloaded so if you don't have internet the printer can't be installed. Once I installed it I could not print label because the software was defective. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Label Software Documentation & Online PDF's  Provided are VERY OLD; Useless
customer_reviews.text: Luckily I used the LabelWriter 450 previously at my work, hence was familiar with setting up and using the LabelWriter 450. The "DYMO Label Software" information in the printed "Quick Start Guide" so outdated that its useless; same with the PDF's on DYMO site. What few DYMO YouTube Videos I found were of no help. The LabelWriter 450 itself works good. The DYMO CD Label a simple/ easy way to make printed labels for CD's and DVD's
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: I HATE this printer with my whole heart!
customer_reviews.text: It eats labels, gets stuck, prints blanks, prints half labels....its just horrible! Sometimes I get lucky and will get a decent run of labels...then it'll just start spitting out blanks and theres no way to stop it...I'll just have to unplug it. If you interrupt the "printing" it then won't read to print the next time. I have to uninstall the printer, reinstall and cross my fingers. It wastes SO many labels...and they're NOT cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not work on 5 different type of computer
customer_reviews.text: I brought this for my husband he starting his own business and Google stated this printed is the best printed. I tried it on 2 laptop and 3 iPad and still did not work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They don't last.
customer_reviews.text: They last about 2 months before the label quality fails. The bar code clarity isn't good at a decent speed of printing. When the setting are changed the print speed is greatly reduce. No good answer from dymo or my pos system tech support. Maybe I've printed 600 or so labels. Be cautious if plan to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: NOT worth it
customer_reviews.text: No soft wear comes with this product, trying to down load Not worth my time, After several attemps I am now trowing this label wht ever in th trash
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bellas

customer_reviews.title: So professional!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love it. I had a hard time setting it up but tech support was INCREDIBLE. Set up took a long time but the issues may have been on my end. Regardless, tech support stayed with me till it was done. I sent out my Christmas cards using the fancy labels. They even had a Christmas tree on the label.
customer_reviews.author: Beastie

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 7 months
customer_reviews.text: I liked the product at first but then it started jamming all the time where the labels roll right back into the printer. It takes for ever to un-jam the labels. Now today was the last straw. When I went to pull up the Dymo printer to print new labels the program wont even come up. Do not buy this printer if you dont liked to be stressed out!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Decent printer
customer_reviews.text: A good little printer. Not so taken with the idea that you have to buy their labels for the stamp option. This was a gift but I also own one and like it. Changing the labels is easy but I am lazy and am tempted to get another one just for address labels. The one I have is permanently loaded with the largest (shipping) labels. Not so taken with the two in one devices so I am not big on the dual printer.
customer_reviews.author: JoninOC

customer_reviews.title: A reliable workhorse
customer_reviews.text: I print all kinds of labels with this thing. It's a total workhorse and hasn't let me down. The physical design is impressive too--very easy to use and swap out labels. I really like the free software that comes with it. Usually bundled software is total crap (stick to making hardware guys!). But, the DYMO label making software is really good.
customer_reviews.author: Barrett H. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer. I like how it holds the roll of labels in one place and they don’t slide around on the spindle.
customer_reviews.author: jwb-Orlando

customer_reviews.title: My Second Purchase, not a replacement, an addition
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase, an addition to it's little brother I bought several years ago. It's a hard worker, never failed to print. Our Stars & Steel Guitars Show has grown so, that we needed a second printer to keep up with the ticket and passes so our crowds don't have to wait to get into the show.
customer_reviews.author: Mary R.

customer_reviews.title: Dymo
customer_reviews.text: Didn't need tech support so I really couldn't rate it. Would be nice if a little more instruction was provided on the software download. Once you realize what you need, simple install & set-up. Works well. Replaced my old Dymo 400. Integrates easy into Word 2019.
customer_reviews.author: The Iman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Label maker
customer_reviews.text: if you need to make labels for files or enveloped this is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: So Useful
customer_reviews.text: Once you download the software from the Dymo site (not just the Dymo Connect software), this thing is awesome! You can print single labels or you can connect it to Microsoft Word and print out what would be sheets of address labels, etc. I'm addicted to labels...for envelopes, storage boxes, books, you name it. This Dymo makes it easy.
customer_reviews.author: MC122

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these printers, one came used and the other came new but I couldn’t get neither to work. I called Dymo tech support and were not able to help me. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: mayra alejandra espinosa

customer_reviews.title: Great product but difficult to set up first time without instructions
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this to print individual spine-labels for our small library, but there are no instructions for where to go to download drivers, or how to set up different sized labels. It took me a while to figure all of this out. Now that that's done, I think it's a great product and look forward to using it to catalogue our library.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Simple once the software works.
customer_reviews.text: Software is somewhat faulty. Doesn’t save . Have to type each label repeatedly.
customer_reviews.author: karengersh

customer_reviews.title: I love my dymo printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thing on sale for my office and I love it. My company wouldn't spring for one so when I saw one for a very reasonable price on the daily deals, I was all over it. It makes my life so much easier for mailing and labeling. The software is user friendly. Highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: pugsNkisses

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT PRINT WITH USB 3.0
customer_reviews.text: On Line instructions IN SMALL PRINT say it will not work with 3.0, nor will it work in a 2.0 powerede mulri that is plugged into a 3.0 computor. No software for this issue has been pushed since WINDOWS 7! Poor Planning and worse support!
customer_reviews.author: Randy Altmann

customer_reviews.title: This is my THIRD DYMO (first upgrade)
customer_reviews.text: We already own two working DYMOS but my computer kept warning me that my system would not support the DYMO software much longer. It was easy to install and has always been easy to use. Every home should have at least one. There never a need to replace ink since the labels are heat printed.
customer_reviews.author: NonnaB

customer_reviews.title: No impressed
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t impressed with this. Actually, I was trying to find a way to print oil change static reminders for my family’s vehicles, but the labels were too thick to feed properly. The software is difficult to use, and the address labels difficult to use as well.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Dana

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy worst printer
customer_reviews.text: Worst thing don’t buy can’t change rolls of paper with out causing major issues. I would of returned mine when I relived how bad it was and wasn’t making anything more efficient but I was so pissed I destroyed it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This printer easily handles all of my label needs for my Amazon FBA business. It’s NEVER had any problems. Easy set-up with my MacBook, too. I use Inventory Labs for my shipments and this printer automatically prints product labels after I submit the product. I don’t even had to think about it, it just happens. This is the perfect label printer for my business.
customer_reviews.author: Lupin1375

customer_reviews.title: finally
customer_reviews.text: After so long, I finally learned how to use it! This is a bit embarrassing...Because I am a bit stupid, I didn't know how to set it after changing labels of different sizes. I didn't learn it until yesterday! LOL
customer_reviews.author: Journey

customer_reviews.title: Quick, Easy, Great Quality Label Printing
customer_reviews.text: Love this new label printer. The provided software is easy to use. The label stock is easy to install. The label print quality is perfect, no smudging, clear, crisp. I've never had a label printer before and I'm very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Tony P.

customer_reviews.title: I use these things
customer_reviews.text: I run a small company and I have been using this printer for years! I love the older software more then the newer because I don't need all the bells and whistles this latest model comes with.. I just want to print and store address . This easy to load easy to print label printer I used to make labels for all of my merchandise bins making my ordering even easier! I have never needed tech support
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Martin

customer_reviews.title: Amazon customer service to the rescue
customer_reviews.text: This arrived without the spool that holds the label rolls, but Amazon covered the cost of a replacement. Prints great, although it sometimes changes the alignment so a label prints with almost no top margin. I print directly from Ricochet software though, so it may be an issue with Ricochet and not the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca S

customer_reviews.title: Great labler
customer_reviews.text: Kind of like the "energizer bunny", just keeps on going. I've had mine for quite a while. Always labeling something. Good for addresses. I'd recommend one to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Don Hill

customer_reviews.title: Works for years, and years!!!
customer_reviews.text: Always works, just make sure to put the label rolls in properly. Labels face down, holes to the left!!! My wife finds endless uses for this thing. Keep your driver updated...
customer_reviews.author: Don H

customer_reviews.title: Printing sizes
customer_reviews.text: This printer is convenient for packaging labels. The only problem I have with this printer is the size of which the label is printed on the sheet. I bought 2-5/16" x 7-1/2" label paper. But when I go to print there are NO options for this size and the largest I can print is on the sheet is (30256 Shipping) *label is bright to sorta hide the customer info, but hopefully you can see what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: Redd

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding label printer!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic. Hook it up in seconds. Tired of sticking a whole sheet of 30 labels in the printer (and printing on wrong side) for one or two labels. I should have bought this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much better than Rollo for non-shipping labels
customer_reviews.text: I use Rollo for shipping labels, but this is so much better for smaller size labels. The DYMO software makes it incredibly easy to customize labels. I should have bought this in the first place vs a Rollo
customer_reviews.author: Melvin

customer_reviews.title: Saves a lot of time
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this from Amazon. It came. Took it out of the box and followed the quick start instructions. Within minutes I was printing address labels. No more taking paper out of my printer and putting in envelopes, adjusting the paper guide, printing an envelope, readjusting the paper guides, putting in the paper. . . just open the DYMO icon on my tool bar and cut and paste an address label and push a button. Should have bought this years ago. I have a Mac.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Graham

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I use it almost daily. I'm doing my family files over and I can put a picture of them on the label, which is ready neat. Of course it is b&w, but still it gives a great touch
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Swift

customer_reviews.title: Struggled with Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: Not compatible with Windows 10. The system requirements stated it can run on Windows 7 or later. Not accurate. I've reached out to the company with no response. Edit: I talked to a Dymo rep on the phone. It took him almost an hour and a half to get the right software on my computer, working remotely (albeit, my laptop is a tad slow). Now the printer works ok. My logo doesn't look great, but it'll do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Catrina

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tiny labeler.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic thermal printer I was getting tired of the cartridge labels and wanted to go with something thermal so I can make more labels without the reel emptying so quickly. DYMO makes some great products. The software could use some upgrades/add ons but still solid.
customer_reviews.author: P. Riley

customer_reviews.title: Everything that I expected
customer_reviews.text: This printer works exactly as expected. It connected quickly and easily with their software and I was printing labels on Windows OS like a fool within a few minutes of it's arrival. I have successfully tested the Dymo Python interface for Linux as well as I have plant to eventually integrate this printer with a custom inventory management system written in Python and running on Linux.
customer_reviews.author: julienj

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer!!
customer_reviews.text: There seem to be many bad reviews for this label maker. My experience so far has been perfect. I downloaded the software on my win 10 computer and plugged the printer in. I loaded the labels and was printing labels in 20 minutes from opening the box. So far, I've printed 200 labels for CD envelopes over the last couple of days and have had zero issues. Software is simple to use and printing is fast. From my experiences with this label maker, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Love the software I have a excell spreadsheet to keep records and I can copy and paste them into another sheet the. The software pulls the updated information and prints! What I used to have to hand write saves me hours in time each week. I think they just came out with a color version I may look at that.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hegreness

customer_reviews.title: AN ABSOLUTE DISASTER!
customer_reviews.text: ABSOLUTELY ONE OF THE WORST PURCHASES I HAVE EVER MADE-I RECEIVED IT TODAY AND HAVE BEEN WORKING FOR THREE HOURS TO GET IT TO WORK CORRECTLY. IT HAS BEEN A NIGHTMARE. I AM NOT A NOVICE WHEN IT COMES TO TECHNOLOGY. THIS PRINTER CONTINUES TO SPIT OUT FIFTEEN LABELS AT A TIME WITHOUT PRINTING. I WILL RETURN THIS AND RETURN TO THE BROTHER PRINTER THAT I WAS REPLACING. THE BROTHER DEVICE WAS VERY EFFICIENT AND PRINTED BEAUTIFULLY. UNFORTUNATELY, IT FELL OFF OF MY DESK AND WAS DAMAGED WHEN IT HIT A TILE FLOOR. I PURCHASED THIS BECAUSE I READ THE GLOWING REVIEWS. I AM SEVERELY DISAPPOINTED.
customer_reviews.author: JUDGE LAD

customer_reviews.title: This printer saves me so much time!
customer_reviews.text: When I need to print a label I can print it very quickly, no loading the printer for one label. It works well, the application is easy to understand and use. The only thing I do not like is that 14 pt is not an option. It is 12 pt and 16 pt as the two options and 14 is usually what I use.
customer_reviews.author: Mary McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Basic Printer
customer_reviews.text: Does the necessary job for printing shipping labels as needed. Very Pleased so far as I have only had it a week basically and have used it a decent amount so far.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Cumberland

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising
customer_reviews.text: My box didn’t come with a label roll!!! But It says in the description it comes with one
customer_reviews.author: Tiffani

customer_reviews.title: Works but not for me
customer_reviews.text: Semi confusing to set up but yes it works for MAC ****shipping labels are smaller than regular 4x6 *** I purchased this as my first label printer and i got the wrong size
customer_reviews.author: Nia

customer_reviews.title: Must be defective units
customer_reviews.text: Still can’t get it to work - but I did not open it for over a month after I got it
customer_reviews.author: kimberly hawke

product_meta.title: DYMO LabelWriter 450 Thermal Label Printer (1752264)
feature_bullets: Eliminate the waste and hassle of sheet labels – print precise quantities without difficulty
Thermal printing technology eliminates the need for expensive ink or toner
Customize and print address, file folder and barcode labels, plus name badges and more with DYMO Label software – all from your PC or Mac*
Save time - create labels directly from text in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, QuickBooks and other programs or easily print addresses from Outlook Contacts or Mac Address Book
Print crystal-clear barcodes, labels and graphics with 600 x 300 dpi resolution
Compatible with Windows 7 or later and Mac OS X v10.8 or later.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,008 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
